author: kcos

review: No off button. I just turn off the TV and when I return the next day it is off. Bizarre. How hard would an on-off button been to include? Pushing the middle button turns it on but not off. A smarter interface would be nice. For example, I am onto season 3 of Downtown Abbey, but I still have to go to season 1 which I put in my Watchlist. Too much work. Just have the next episode ready for me to start after I turn the unit on. Also, when I am scrolling through all the episodes, they are not marked as "already viewed" and so it can be difficult to remember which one I need to watch next. Some of the apps, like Disney HD are useless unless you already subscribe to them on cable/satellite. I keep forgetting it has voice recognition. Maybe that is how you turn it off.

review: Just got this today. Super fast/east set up. No lag time. I expect to get rid of satellite at the end of the month. Looks like all I'll be needing from now on.
author: Sherrill

review: We enjoy the Fire Tv but I will say that I expected much more for being a prime member.  You get everyone started watching season 1 of a show and starting with season 2 you charge 2.00 or so a show.  Im not happy with that.  But I love having everything in 1 place.  I am disappointed with how money hungry you all are.  I get everything on Netflix for the price I pay.  No hidden charges. Hmm go figure.
